clinical_study.brief_title: Analgesia Duration of Dexamethasone, Buprenorphine, or Clonidine With Ropivacaine for Interscalene Nerve Block
clinical_study.official_title: A Prospective Triple-masked Randomized Controlled Trial Measuring Analgesia Duration of Dexamethasone, Buprenorphine, or Clonidine With Ropivacaine for Interscalene Nerve Block

brief_summary.textblock: This is a prospective randomized controlled triple-masked study looking at the duration of nerve block analgesia when using the listed adjuvants (dexamethasone, buprenorphine and clonidine) plus ropivacaine versus plain ropivacaine alone.

detailed_description.textblock: This is a prospective randomized controlled triple-masked study looking at the duration of nerve block analgesia when using the listed adjuvants (dexamethasone, buprenorphine and clonidine) plus ropivacaine versus plain ropivacaine alone. This will be looked on on patients undergoing painful shoulder surgery in the ambulatory surgery center. Patients will be randomized to one of four groups (1. 0.75% plain ropivacaine. The reference comparator 2. A mixture of 0.75% ropivacaine with 300 mcg buprenorphine 3. A mixture of 0.75% ropivacaine with 75 mcg clonidine 4. A mixture of 0.75% ropivacaine with and 8mg dexamethasone) for their regimen in the interscalene block for their surgery. The patients will then be called within 3 days post-operatively to follow-up. Follow-up data collected will be when did the patient experience return of pain to the operative limb (duration of analgesia), when did the patient experience return of motor function of the operative limb (duration of motor block) and when did the patient experience return of sensation of the operative limb (return of sensory block). All three of these adjuvants have been studied previously and shown to have increased analgesic duration with local anesthesia, but have never had a good comparative study. The mechanism of action of the analgesia for these adjuvants pain relief has never been shown although it is likely a indirect effect as there are animal studies looking at their effect on A and C fibers that did not show those results.

study_design_info.masking: Quadruple (Participant, Care Provider, Investigator, Outcomes Assessor)

primary_outcome.description: Patients are called 1-3 days post-operatively to assess when the analgesia of their nerve block wore off

secondary_outcome.description: Patients are assessed from needle removal to when they are no longer able to feel cold on the blocked extremity
Patients are called 1-3 days post-operatively to assess when the sensory component of their nerve block wore off

Patients are called 1-3 days post-operatively to assess if they had any side effects of the adjuvants such as nausea, vomiting or itching. There blood pressure is looked at pre-op and compared to post-op. Any prolonged PACU (Post Anesthesia Care Unit) stay for sedation is recorded.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Patients Vomiting in the PACU (Post-Anesthesia Care Unit)
secondary_outcome.description: Vomiting in PACU (Post-Anesthesia Care Unit) for patients was looked at

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Patients Reporting Nausea at Home
secondary_outcome.description: Patients are called 1-3 days post-operatively to assess if they had any side effects of the adjuvants such as nausea, vomiting or itching. There blood pressure is looked at pre-op and compared to post-op. Any prolonged PACU (Post Anesthesia Care Unit) stay for sedation is recorded.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Patients Reporting Nausea in the PACU
secondary_outcome.description: PACU (Post-Anesthesia Care Unit) assessment of nausea
Patients are called 1-3 days post-operatively to assess when motor component of their nerve block wore off

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Patients With Blood Pressure (BP) Changes in the PACU
secondary_outcome.description: Blood pressure changes in PACU (Post-Anesthesia Care Unit) for patients was looked at

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Patient With Blood Pressure Changes in the Second Stage Recovery Area
secondary_outcome.description: Blood pressure changes in Second Stage Recovery Area for patients was looked at

secondary_outcome.measure: Pain Score Reported by Patients at First Phone Call
secondary_outcome.description: Patients are called 1-3 days post-operatively to assess pain. Pain score is 0-10 scale with 0 is no pain and 10 is most severe pain.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Patients Reporting Itching in the PACU
secondary_outcome.description: Patients itching was assessed post-op in the PACU.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Patients Reporting Itching at Home
secondary_outcome.description: Patients are called 1-3 days post-operatively to assess if they had any side effects of the adjuvants such as nausea, vomiting or itching. There blood pressure is looked at pre-op and compared to post-op. Any prolonged PACU (Post Anesthesia Care Unit) stay for sedation is recorded.

arm_group.description: Plain Ropivacaine 0.75%, (225 mg) total volume 32 cc for interscalene block given pre-operatively
A mixture of 0.75% ropivacaine with 300 mcg buprenorphine, total volume 32 cc for interscalene block given pre-operatively
A mixture of 0.75% ropivacaine with 75 mcg clonidine, total volume 32 cc for interscalene block given pre-operatively
A mixture of 0.75% ropivacaine with and 8 mg dexamethasone, total volume 32 cc for interscalene block given pre-operatively

intervention.description: Only ropivacaine 0.75% is administered for this arm of the interscalene block
Ropivacaine 0.75% + 300 mcg Buprenorphine is administered for this arm of the interscalene block
Ropivacaine 0.75% + 75 mcg Clonidine is administered for this arm of the interscalene block
Ropivacaine 0.75% + 8 mg Dexamethasone is administered for this arm of the interscalene block

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Patients who have or are:
1. Orthopedics service patients having shoulder surgery
2. ASA(American Society of Anesthesiologists) class I, II, or III.
3. Patients at least 18 years old but less than 71 years old.
4. Patients giving informed consent.
5. Non-Emergency Surgery
Exclusion Criteria:
- Patients who have or are:
1. An inability to cooperate during the block placement.
2. Neuropathy of the planned extremity to block
3. Diabetes
4. Documented Kidney Disease
5. Documented Liver Disease
6. A lack of or inability to give informed consent.
7. Currently incarcerated.
8. Pregnant

facility.name: University of Iowa Hospital and Clinics, Ambulatory Surgery Clinic

measure.title: Number of Patients Reporting Nausea at Home
measure.description: Patients are called 1-3 days post-operatively to assess if they had any side effects of the adjuvants such as nausea, vomiting or itching. There blood pressure is looked at pre-op and compared to post-op. Any prolonged PACU (Post Anesthesia Care Unit) stay for sedation is recorded.
measure.population: 1 patient in the Plain Ropivacaine group and the Ropivacaine and Buprenorphine group did not complete the survey about nausea at home and therefore was not included in the analysis

outcome.title: Number of Patients Reporting Nausea in the PACU
outcome.description: PACU (Post-Anesthesia Care Unit) assessment of nausea

group.title: Plain Ropivacaine
group.description: Plain Ropivacaine 0.75%, (225 mg) total volume 32 cc for interscalene block given pre-operatively Ropivacaine 0.75%: Only ropivacaine 0.75% is administered for this arm of the interscalene block

group.title: Ropivacaine + Buprenorphine
group.description: A mixture of 0.75% ropivacaine with 300 mcg buprenorphine, total volume 32 cc for interscalene block given pre-operatively Ropivacaine 0.75% + 300 mcg buprenorphine: Ropivacaine 0.75% + 300 mcg buprenorphine is administered for this arm of the interscalene block

group.title: Ropivacaine + Clonidine
group.description: A mixture of 0.75% ropivacaine with 75 mcg clonidine, total volume 32 cc for interscalene block given pre-operatively Ropivacaine 0.75% + 75 mcg clonidine: Ropivacaine 0.75% + 75 mcg clonidine is administered for this arm of the interscalene block

group.title: Ropivacaine + Dexamethasone
group.description: A mixture of 0.75% ropivacaine with and 8 mg dexamethasone, total volume 32 cc for interscalene block given pre-operatively Ropivacaine 0.75% + 8 mg dexamethasone: Ropivacaine 0.75% + 8 mg dexamethasone is administered for this arm of the interscalene block

measure.description: PACU (Post-Anesthesia Care Unit) assessment of nausea

outcome.title: Motor Duration of Block
outcome.description: Patients are called 1-3 days post-operatively to assess when motor component of their nerve block wore off

outcome.title: Pain Score Reported by Patients at First Phone Call
outcome.description: Patients are called 1-3 days post-operatively to assess pain. Pain score is 0-10 scale with 0 is no pain and 10 is most severe pain.

reported_events.time_frame: The adverse advents data was collected from Day 1 until Day 3 when the phone call was made. We do have a post-block clinic where patients with adverse events post-block are seen. None from the study were seen here.

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: There is NOT an agreement between Principal Investigators and the Sponsor (or its agents) that restricts the PI's rights to discuss or publish trial results after the trial is completed.
